prompt:
You are now in a 20 by 10 maze. The maze is divided into two areas: the obstacle area and the free area. The color of obstacle area is Burgundy, and the color of free area is Peach. You need to find a path from the start point to the end point. The color of start point is Green, and the color end point is Gold.
You can move up, down, left, or right. The maze has some markers to help you find the path. Now you need to find a path from the start point to the end point.
text: Error: CUDA out of memory. Tried to allocate 20.00 MiB. GPU 0 has a total capacity of 7.60 GiB of which 570.81 MiB is free. Including non-PyTorch memory, this process has 6.98 GiB memory in use. 6.84 GiB allowed; Of the allocated memory 6.82 GiB is allocated by PyTorch, and 13.83 MiB is reserved by PyTorch but unallocated. If reserved but unallocated memory is large try setting PYTORCH_CUDA_ALLOC_CONF=expandable_segments:True to avoid fragmentation.  See documentation for Memory Management  (https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/notes/cuda.html#environment-variables)
truth: To navigate through the 20 by 10 maze, start by moving down 2 steps from the green start point. Look for the marker labeled "9R" and head left for 3 steps. When you reach the marker labeled "2c," continue moving down for 4 steps until you reach the gold end point. Be sure to avoid the burgundy obstacles and stay within the peach-colored free area. Good luck!
